summary: This is a federal search and seizure warrant authorizing the forensic review of 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties in New York and the U.S. Virgin Islands. The warrant, signed by Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein, seeks evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement, and conspiracy from 1994 to 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the warrant; devices were seized from his person and his residences in New York and the Virgin Islands as part of an investigation into sex trafficking and related offenses.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Specifically named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein; the search seeks evidence of communications with her and her involvement in the subject offenses.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: The judge who signed and issued the search and seizure warrant on June 26, 2020.

connections.description: The warrant explicitly identifies Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the alleged sex trafficking offenses, and seeks evidence of communications between them.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein and device seizure
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI, and two electronic devices (an iPad and iPhone) were seized from his person.

events.title: Search of Epstein's New York residence
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's private residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, and seized 33 electronic devices.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James island
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's private island, Little Saint James in the U.S. Virgin Islands, and seized 27 electronic devices from various structures.

events.title: Warrant issued for device review
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein issued the search warrant authorizing forensic review of the 62 seized devices for evidence of specified crimes.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Epstein's New York residence)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Epstein's private island)
keyFacts: A total of 62 electronic devices were seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties: 2 from his person upon arrest, 33 from his New York mansion, and 27 from his private island in the Virgin Islands.
The warrant explicitly names Ghislaine Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein and authorizes a search for evidence of communications with her.

The search seeks evidence of crimes including sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591), transportation of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 2422), enticement to travel (18 U.S.C. ยง 2423), and conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371).
The authorized search period covers a vast timeframe from 1994 through August 8, 2019, indicating a long-term investigation into Epstein's activities.

The warrant authorizes the search for specific categories of evidence, including nude or sexually suggestive photos of teenage girls, travel records for victims, financial payment records, and child erotica.
